intro: Diplotaxis virgata f. saharensis, commonly known as the Saharan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. It produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its survival in harsh environments. Due to its resilience, it is often found in disturbed or degraded habitats across the Sahara.
